page.title: 09Employment in Melchbourne
page.content: Under 50% of households in Melchbourne are of working age, most of the residents are over 60 and have retired. Some people still farm locally, but others travel to London, Bedford and Rushden to work. There are several craftsmen in the village; a potter, a woodworker, a lady who makes lampshades and a couple who knit jumpers to any design or picture you choose. The occupations of those working out of the village are very varied and include a builder,a solicitor and somebody involved in the blind letter press business.
